articles.title: Large crowds mourn Iranian general, others killed in U.S. air strike
articles.description: With shouts of "Death to America", tens of thousands of people marched in Iraq on Saturday to mourn Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani and an Iraqi militia leader who were killed in a U.S. air strike that has raised the specter of wider conflict in t…
articles.content: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - With shouts of “Death to America”, tens of thousands of people marched in Iraq on Saturday to mourn Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani and an Iraqi militia leader who were killed in a U.S. air strike that has raised the specter of… [+6380 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Terrorism not ruled out in fatal stabbing near Paris
articles.description: French investigators said they had not dismissed possible links to terrorism after a man went on a rampage with a knife in a park near Paris on Friday, killing one person and wounding two. Police shot the man dead.
articles.content:
PARIS (Reuters) - French investigators said they had not dismissed possible links to terrorism after a man went on a rampage with a knife in a park near Paris on Friday, killing one person and wounding two. Police shot the man dead. 
“An act of terrorism can… [+955 chars]

articles.title: Multiple rockets fall in Green Zone, Baghdad, air base: Iraqi military
articles.description: Several rockets fell on Saturday inside Baghdad's heavily fortified Green Zone, its Jadriya neighborhood, and the Balad air base housing U.S. troops, the Iraqi military said, adding that there were no deaths.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Several rockets fell on Saturday inside Baghdad’s heavily fortified Green Zone, its Jadriya neighborhood, and the Balad air base housing U.S. troops, the Iraqi military said, adding that there were no deaths.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Fourteen killed in bomb attack on bus of school children in Burkina Faso
articles.description: Fourteen people were killed and nine wounded in a bomb attack on a bus bringing children back from a school break in northern Burkina Faso on Saturday, two security sources and a police source said.
articles.content:
DAKAR (Reuters) - Fourteen people were killed and nine wounded in a bomb attack on a bus bringing children back from a school break in northern Burkina Faso on Saturday, two security sources and a police source said.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Five wounded in mortar attack on Baghdad neighborhood: police sources
articles.description: A mortar was launched inside Baghdad's Jadriya neighborhood on Saturday and wounded five people, police sources told Reuters.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - A mortar was launched inside Baghdad’s Jadriya neighborhood on Saturday and wounded five people, police sources told Reuters. 
Writing by Ahmed Aboulenein; Editing by Maha El Dahan

articles.title: Fourteen killed in bomb attack on bus of school children in Burkina Faso
articles.description: Fourteen people were killed and nine wounded in a bomb attack on a bus carrying school children in northern Burkina Faso near the border with Mali on Saturday, two security sources and a police source said.
articles.content:

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Rod Stewart, son face charges over New Year's Eve fracas in Florida
articles.description: The British rock singer Rod Stewart and his eldest son, Sean, are facing battery charges for an altercation with a hotel security guard at a New Year's Eve party in Palm Beach, Florida, local media reported.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - The British rock singer Rod Stewart and his eldest son, Sean, are facing battery charges for an altercation with a hotel security guard at a New Year’s Eve party in Palm Beach, Florida, local media reported. 
The two men are due to appear in cour… [+746 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Amazon considers opening stores in Germany: report
articles.description: Amazon.com is considering opening stores in Germany, its second biggest market after the United States, the ecommerce company's head in the country was quoted as saying on Saturday.
articles.content:
BERLIN (Reuters) - Amazon.com is considering opening stores in Germany, its second biggest market after the United States, the ecommerce company’s head in the country was quoted as saying on Saturday. 
“The fact is that we know that customers shop offline an… [+576 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Two rockets fall inside Iraqi air base housing U.S. troops: security sources
articles.description: Two Katyusha rockets fell inside Iraq's Balad air base, 80 km (50 miles) north of Baghdad, which houses U.S. forces on Saturday but caused no casualties, two security sources told Reuters.
articles.content:
TIKRIT, Iraq (Reuters) - Two Katyusha rockets fell inside Iraq’s Balad air base, 80 km (50 miles) north of Baghdad, which houses U.S. forces on Saturday but caused no casualties, two security sources told Reuters. 
Reporting by Ghazwan Jabouri; Writing by Ah… [+39 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Rocket falls near U.S. embassy in Baghdad, no casualties: police sources
articles.description: A Katyusha rocket fell near the United States embassy in Baghdad's heavily fortified Green Zone which houses government buildings and foreign missions on Friday but caused no casualties, two police sources told Reuters.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - A Katyusha rocket fell near the United States embassy in Baghdad’s heavily fortified Green Zone which houses government buildings and foreign missions on Friday but caused no casualties, two police sources told Reuters. 
The rocket fell i… [+121 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Blasts heard in Iraqi capital Baghdad, causes unknown
articles.description: Two loud blasts were heard in Baghdad early Saturday evening, Reuters witnesses said. It was not immediately possible to confirm the causes or locations.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Two loud blasts were heard in Baghdad early Saturday evening, Reuters witnesses said. It was not immediately possible to confirm the causes or locations. 
Reporting by Ahmed Aboulenein; Editing by Maha El Dahan
